channel.title: CVE Feed for SevenSpark -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for SevenSpark -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-5164|2024-08-02T07:52:07.513Z -- sevenspark -- bellows%20accordion%20menu
item.description: The Bellows Accordion Menu plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via shortcodes in versions up to, and including, 1.4.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2023-6630|2024-08-02T08:35:14.820Z -- sevenspark -- contact%20form%207%20%E2%80%93%20dynamic%20text%20extension
item.description: The Contact Form 7 â€“ Dynamic Text Extension plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Insecure Direct Object Reference in all versions up to, and including, 4.1.0 via the CF7_get_custom_field and CF7_get_current_user shortcodes due to missing validation on a user controlled key. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor access or higher to access arbitrary metadata of any post type, referencing the post by id and the meta by key.

item.title: CVE-2024-3593|2024-06-28T17:48:19.760Z -- sevenspark -- ubermenu
item.description: The UberMenu plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 3.8.3. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the ubermenu_delete_all_item_settings and ubermenu_reset_settings functions. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete and reset the plugin's settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-4710|2024-06-04T17:54:11.285Z -- sevenspark -- ubermenu
item.description: The UberMenu plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's ubermenu-col, ubermenu_mobile_close_button, ubermenu_toggle, ubermenu-search shortcodes in all versions up to, and including, 3.8.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
